intro: Biscutella megacarpaea subsp. variegata, commonly known as the variegated biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in spring. Its subspecies variegata is distinguished by the variegated leaf patterns, which can include white or yellow markings. This plant is adapted to harsh, arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
